definition.name: Dependency Review
definition.description: Prevent the introduction of dependencies with known vulnerabilities
definition.author: GitHub

inputs.name: repo-token
inputs.description: Token for the repository. Can be passed in using `{{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}`.

inputs.name: fail-on-severity
inputs.description: Don't block PRs below this severity. Possible values are `low`, `moderate`, `high`, `critical`.

inputs.name: fail-on-scopes
inputs.description: Dependency scopes to block PRs on. Comma-separated list. Possible values are 'unknown', 'runtime', and 'development' (e.g. "runtime, development")

inputs.name: base-ref
inputs.description: The base git ref to be used for this check. Has a default value when the workflow event is `pull_request` or `pull_request_target`. Must be provided otherwise.

inputs.name: head-ref
inputs.description: The head git ref to be used for this check. Has a default value when the workflow event is `pull_request` or `pull_request_target`. Must be provided otherwise.

inputs.name: config-file
inputs.description: A path to the configuration file for the action.

inputs.name: allow-licenses
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of allowed licenses (e.g. "MIT, GPL 3.0, BSD 2 Clause")

inputs.name: deny-licenses
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of forbidden licenses (e.g. "MIT, GPL 3.0, BSD 2 Clause")

inputs.name: allow-dependencies-licenses
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of dependencies in purl format (e.g. "pkg:npm/express, pkg:pypi/pycrypto"). These dependencies will be permitted to use any license, no matter what license policy is enforced otherwise.

inputs.name: allow-ghsas
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of allowed GitHub Advisory IDs (e.g. "GHSA-abcd-1234-5679, GHSA-efgh-1234-5679")

inputs.name: external-repo-token
inputs.description: A token for fetching external configuration file if it lives in another repository. It is required if the repository is private

inputs.name: license-check
inputs.description: A boolean to determine if license checks should be performed

inputs.name: vulnerability-check
inputs.description: A boolean to determine if vulnerability checks should be performed

inputs.name: comment-summary-in-pr
inputs.description: Determines if the summary is posted as a comment in the PR itself. Setting this to `always` or `on-failure` requires you to give the workflow `pull-requests: write` permissions

inputs.name: deny-packages
inputs.description: A comma-separated list of package URLs to deny (e.g. "pkg:npm/express, pkg:pypi/pycrypto"). If version specified, only deny matching packages and version; else, deny all regardless of version.

inputs.name: deny-groups
inputs.description: A comma-separated list of package URLs for group(s)/namespace(s) to deny (e.g. "pkg:npm/express/, pkg:pypi/pycrypto/"). Please note that the group name must be followed by a `/`.

inputs.name: retry-on-snapshot-warnings
inputs.description: Whether to retry on snapshot warnings

inputs.name: retry-on-snapshot-warnings-timeout
inputs.description: Number of seconds to wait before stopping snapshot retries.

inputs.name: warn-only
inputs.description: When set to `true` this action will always complete with success, overriding the `fail-on-severity` parameter.

inputs.name: show-openssf-scorecard
inputs.description: Show a summary of the OpenSSF Scorecard scores.

inputs.name: warn-on-openssf-scorecard-level
inputs.description: Numeric threshold for the OpenSSF Scorecard score. If the score is below this threshold, the action will warn you.
